page.title: 10The Post Office in Ousden
page.content: The Post Office and general store is probably the hub of village life, kept by the Sub Postmistress, the shop keeps all the usual foods including meat, sausages and bacon, fruit and vegetables, greeting cards, medicines and holds a licence for wines and spirits. One need not leave the village at all for shopping. Services also include laundry and dry cleaning, for which they are the agents. The owners will also deliver if people are unable to get out. The Sub Post Office main use is the sale of pastage and saving stamps for television etc, also the transactions of pensions, family allowances and the use of Giro Bank services. The letters and parcels for the village are delivered from Newmarket by van, the postman coming twice daily when he also makes collec- tions from the post boxes & office.
